intro: Maytenus robusta, commonly known as the robust mayten, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Central and South America. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its thick, leathery leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers followed by fleshy, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Maytenus robusta is often found in humid lowland forests and is valued for its hard, durable wood. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecosystems it inhabits.
